notes.text: Coursework bridging computer science with human factors, neuroscience, security, and software engineering.

items.title: COSC 559 - Human-Computer Interaction
items.subtitle: Fundamentals of HCI examining how human factors affect interface design and usability, covering perception, cognition, and user-centered design methodologies.

items.title: PSYC 410 - Sensory Processes and Perception
items.subtitle: Exploration of how sensory systems process information and how perception emerges from neural mechanisms, with relevance to computational neuroscience and cognitive science.

items.title: ECE 598 - Robust, Secure and AI Trustworthy
items.subtitle: Study of robustness, security, and trustworthiness in AI systems, covering adversarial attacks, defense mechanisms, fairness, interpretability, and reliable AI deployment.

items.title: COSC 465 - Databases and Scripting Languages
items.subtitle: In-depth focus on developing a strong understanding of the basics of databases and their usage in web applications as well as an introduction to various scripting languages.

items.title: COSC 370 - Introduction to Scientific Computing
items.subtitle: An in-depth focus on the implementation, analysis, and design of numerical algorithms with the Python programming language in order to solve problems in science and engineering.

items.title: COSC 365 - Programming Languages and Systems
items.subtitle: An in-depth study of the design, implementation, and application of programming languages as well as an introduction to the basics of operating systems.
